Author: brett
Content:
Interesting idea. If your consumer's are going to redistribute your product anyways just embrace and encourage them as distribution channels.

The if you can't beat 'em, join 'em approach to piracy.

Interesting to think about the logistics of how it might/could work? How do companies take affiliate networks and apply them to all their customers, allowing the customers to make affiliate sales to any the come across on or offline? Would it even be feasible offline? Cell phones?

Author: vikram
Content: I think you can't pay salary. What about expenses? I think if it's profitable (won't that be nice in the 1st 3 months) one can always pay dividends to shareholders.

Author: noisemaker
Title: Advice to Young Men from an Old Man

Author: dfranke
Content: However, in "How to be Silicon Valley" he singled Boulder as a place with most of the ingredients for being a startup hub even though it currently isn't.  So there are probably worse places to be.  Still at best a distant third, though.
